text: Foster Sylvers is the debut album by Foster Sylvers from the R&B; group The Sylvers. Released in 1973, it was produced by Jerry Peters and Keg Johnson. ==Track listing== #"Misdemeanor" (Leon Sylvers III) #"Big Things Come in Small Packages" (Leon Sylvers III) #"I'm Your Puppet" (Dan Penn, Spooner Oldham) #"Mockingbird" (Charlie Foxx, Inez Foxx) #"I'll Get You In The End" (Leon Sylvers III) #"Hey Little Girl" #"Happy Face" #"Swooperman" #"More Love" #"Only My Love Is True" #"Lullabye / Uncle Albert" ==Charts== ===Album=== {| class="wikitable" |- !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|1973 |align="left"|U.S. Album Chart |align="left"|159 |- |align="left"|1973 |align="left"|Top R&B;/Black Albums |align="left"|31 |} ==Samples== *"Misdemeanor" **"It's Funky Enough"" by The D.O.C. on his No One Can Do It Better album and "Tear The Roof Off" by Grandmaster Flash on his album Ba-Dop-Boom-Bang. *"More Love" **"No Brain"" by Madvillain on their Madvillainy 2: The Madlib Remix album “out of sight” by Run The Jewels ==References== ==External links== * Foster Sylvers – Foster Sylvers (1973) at Discogs Category:1973 debut albums Category:Foster Sylvers albums Category:Albums produced by Jerry Peters Category:MGM Records albums
title: Foster Sylvers (1973 album)
